item.title: About
item.description: I grew up in Colorado, moving to Pittsburgh to attend Carnegie Mellon University for my undergraduate degree, before moving to Baltimore to begin my graduate education at Johns Hopkins University. I spent a few years in Boston while working at Amazon, but was drawn back to the Chesapeake and am currently living in D.C. I spend a lot of my time biking around, occasionally taking pictures. While I do enjoy nature a lot, I am particularly into urban environments.

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2024 M. Maciejewski, D. Klement, R. Huang, M. Wisner, S. Khudanpur. Evaluating the Santa Barbara Corpus: Challenges of the Breadth of Conversational Spoken Language. Interspeech. 2024 [ISCA] D. Raj, M. Wiesner, M. Maciejewski, L.P. Garcia-Perera, D. Povey, S. Khudanpur. On Speaker Attribution with SURT. Odyssey. 2024 [arXiv] D. Palzer, M. Maciejewski, E. Fosler-Lussier. Improving Neural Diarization Through Speaker Attribute Attractors and Local Dependency Modeling. IEEE ICASSP. 2024 [IEEE Xplore] 2023 S.
